sn56.7:4.1: “Mendicants, don’t think bad, unskillful thoughts, such as
sn56.7:4.4: Because those thoughts aren’t beneficial or relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. They don’t lead to disillusionment, fading away, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
sn56.7:5.1: When you think, you should think: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
sn56.7:5.3: Because those thoughts are beneficial and relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. They lead to disillusionment, fading away, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
sn56.7:6.1: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
